boat.name: Thalia
boat.full_description:
Thalia, built in 1888, was one of the last yachts by George Wanhill of Poole who had been boatbuilding from the 1850s onwards. In the 1890s she went to Cork and raced from the Royal Cork Yacht Club, returning to the south coast of England in 1918.

She was bought by Ivan Jefris in 1997 from Coombes Yard as she was about to be broken up. Having extensively rebuilt her he raced her In Solent A|rea races and entered her in the America's Cup Jubilee, 2001, and then sailed her to the Carribean.

Bought by David Aisher in 2010, she returned to England for a refit at the Elephant Boatyard. A new mast was fitted with new standing and running rigging and sails. She was also re ballasted and rewired and replumbed.
boat.construction_details: Elm below, pitch pine above on grown oak, bronze fastened and part copper sheathed.
boat.short_description: Thalia was built in 1888 and has cruised and has raced extensively on both sides of the Atlantic.
